page.title: 16THE SHIP INN,FARNBOROUGH
page.content: The {Ship Inn}is about 400 years old. It was originally called {The Royal {Anne }and was renamed{The Royal George after the launch of a larger ship.It received its present name from its present owners much later.Mrs Norbran, who has worked there for 16 years, was able to tell us that one room was often used by{Dick Turpin.}A {fight } was to take place in 1860 between Tom Sayers and Hoonan.The ring was pitched in a field at the brook behind the inn by{Princess Eugenie}who lived at the nearby {abbey}So popular was the fight that the hayfield in which it took place was completely ruined.The fight took place on April 17th 1860 and was a draw.
